name: AIRPARK INTERNATIONAL I t/a Park-N-Go, et al., Petitioners, v. INTERBORO SCHOOL DISTRICT, Respondent
name_abbreviation: Airpark International I v. Interboro School District

parties: AIRPARK INTERNATIONAL I t/a Park-N-Go, et al., Petitioners, v. INTERBORO SCHOOL DISTRICT, Respondent.

opinions.text:
ORDER
PER CURIAM.
AND NOW, this 23rd day of June, 1997, the Petition for Allowance of Appeal is hereby GRANTED, BUT LIMITED to the following issues:
whether the Commonwealth Court erred in characterizing the School District’s tax as a “transaction” tax; and whether the Commonwealth Court’s decision undermines the intent of the Pennsylvania Legislature, expressed in the Local Tax Reform Act, to prohibit political subdivisions from enacting business privilege or mercantile taxes measured by gross receipts.
opinions.author: PER CURIAM.

attorneys: Richard H. Martin, Philadelphia, for Petitioner.
casebody.head_matter:
694 A.2d 618
AIRPARK INTERNATIONAL I t/a Park-N-Go, et al., Petitioners, v. INTERBORO SCHOOL DISTRICT, Respondent.
Supreme Court of Pennsylvania.
June 23, 1997.
Richard H. Martin, Philadelphia, for Petitioner.
